timeline.message:
GH-2028 add support for evaluation of TripleRef nodes in StrictEvaluationStrategy

Signed-off-by: damyan.ognyanov <damyan.ognyanov@ontotext.com>

timeline.bodyText: Why are these checks necessary? Isn't this check already supposed to be done by RDFStarTripleSource.getRdfStarTriples?
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: It is like that to cover the case in which the implementation does not provide results that match the arguments but dump everything that is a Triple in the result iteration. Just a double check which does not put much overhead but ensure a correctness of the results.
replies.author: damyan-ognyanov

timeline.bodyText: This is minor, but since this is a behavioral interface it doesn't have to extend TripleSource - just thinking ahead of a possible future design where TripleSource and RDFStarTripleSource methods are not provided by the same object.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: The interface as is, does not provide any other meaningful uses for the classes that implement it. It makes sence only for those classes that also implement TripleSource that's why it extends TripleSource.
replies.author: damyan-ognyanov

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure I agree with that, but as said it's minor, fine to keep as-is, my "possible future design" may well be a YAGNI.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure I follow where this extVar comes from. Is this intended to encapsulate use of RDF* triples in things like BIND clauses? Why not use a BindingSetAssignment for that case?
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText:
Not sure how BindingSetAssignment can be re-used.
Each reference to a Triple in the SPARQL* syntax is translated (recursively) to a TripleRef that provides bindings (instances of Triple) through it's extVar and that ext var is used at the place where the reference appear. E.g.:

the Statement pattern << ?s ?p ?o>> ?predicate ?object . is translated to a Join between [TripleRef(?s ?p?o) to ?anon_ext] and [?anon_ext ?predicate ?object]
or in the case of bind:
BIND(<<?s ?p ?o>> as ?t) is translated to [TripleRef(?s ?p ?o) to ?anon_ext] and [BIND(?anon_ext as ?t)]
replies.author: damyan-ognyanov

replies.bodyText: Of course, that makes sense, thanks for clarifying!
replies.author: jeenbroekstra
